outputs.output_descr:
The Justice Sector requires more capacity building (institutional, human, infrastructure and equipment), in order to create sound conditions for citizens to enjoy the right to access justice. To contribute to this goal, the project will aim to achieve the following outputs: 
a) Administration of penal justice at decentralized level, strengthened 
b) Correctional services unified and reformed
c) Organization against crime, strengthened

In order to be fully compliant with and protect the rights of citizens, Justice institutions need to address cross cutting issues in the administration of justice services and within their internal work. To contribute to this, the project aims to achieve the following outputs: 
a) Human Rights protected by justice institutions
b) Gender issues in justice administration, promoted
c) HIV and AIDS legal related matters promoted

The correctional system is currently using outdated law (from about the year 1933). In order to align the legislation with the constitution and international standards, UNDP will provide technical advisory services to the sector, with the aim to achieve the following outputs: 
Output 1) Lawmakers, parliamentarians and relevant stakeholders sensitized on the need for new prison legislation
Output 2) Amended legislative framework in the prison system in line with the National Constitution and with the universally accepted principles on the treatment of prisoners
Outpu 3) Alternatives to imprisonment introduced in Mozambique

POLICE PROJECT: 
This project aim to strengthen the capacity of Technical Unit for the Implementation of Strategic Plan of the Police of Mozambique and to improve the operation capacity of the police through the establishment of the National Crime Observatory. The proposed outputs are as follows:
Output 1) Strengthening the capacity of Technical Unit for the Implementation of Strategic Plan of the Police of Mozambique
Output 2) Operational capacity of the Police through the establishing of National Crime Observatory improved
Output 3) Improved professional development as a result of the support to the Human resources system and training
Output 4) Improved capacity for planning and financial management
Output 5) Improved HIV/AIDS support to affected and infected police officers

The correctional system is currently using outdated law (from about the year 1933). In order to align the legislation with the constitution and international standards, UNDP will provide technical advisory services to the sector, with the aim to achieve the following outputs:

Outpu 3) Alternatives to imprisonment introduced in Mozambique

This project aim to strengthen the capacity of Technical Unit for the Implementation of Strategic Plan of the Police of Mozambique and to improve the operation capacity of the police through the establishment of the National Crime Observatory. The proposed outputs are as follows:
Output 1) Strengthening the capacity of Technical Unit for the Implementation of Strategic Plan of the Police of Mozambique

project_descr: Supporting Citizen's Access to Justice through strengthened Penal Justice Administration and protection/implementation of cross cutting matters in justice sector
